critique: This document is an executive order that allows the Senate Committee on Agriculture and Forestry to inspect tax returns from 1950 to 1959. It is related to the investigation of the Commodity Credit Corporation and other activities of the Department of Agriculture. The order itself doesn't directly relate to ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. However, the fact that it is an executive order that grants access to private tax information could be seen as a slight expansion of executive power and a potential infringement on privacy. The investigation into the Department of Agriculture could have implications for economic regulation, depending on the findings.
